channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Unbelievable, 9th December
item.description:
Yesterday’s mattresses etc. cleared and someone thought they would fill the space and leave an old settee, cushions and packing boxes with the persons address on it. I won’t leave those details here but have taken a photo should the council want to follow up with the person who tipped this. It’s blocking the pavement too.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brookdene Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish strewn over footpath, 9th December
item.description:
After bin collection today (paper, kitchen waste, and black bins) there is rubbish spread on pathway outside 173 Leesons Hill. My wife uses crutches and this creates a slip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 173, Leesons Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Yet more fly tipping by Therfield, 9th December
item.description:
You need to send a letter to the residents of Therfeild Court because they use this corner as their own personal dumping ground and it’s ruining this street for all the other residents. They should be fined - why are “we” picking up the bill for them!?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Casbeard Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 9th December
item.description:
This car does not belong to any residents and has been left in the residents car park for 3 days and is parked in a residents bay. No one in the area recognises this car, it is new to the area but is in a bad condition with the car loaded with various items. Due to it being parked in a bay, it is now causing cars to be blocked when all residents are home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southey Road, Oval, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lower Osbaldeston Road Rubbish Nuisance, 9th December
item.description:
Rubbish nuisance outside 24 Osbaldeston Road is disgusting and attracting vermin. Its been ongoing for quite a while now and nothing is ever being done about it. The whole road now seems strewn with rubbish as people seem think its fine to do.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Osbaldeston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 52 Bins Rubbish and faeces on path, 9th December
item.description:
Address 52 continously leave bins and rubbish on path. Faeces can be seen in picture. Food waste attracting vermin and flies etc. Last report closed and said is was completed and it was not. Fine needs issued and path needs clearing and cleaned.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
